data.meta_description: The Nobel Prize in Literature 1925 was awarded to George Bernard Shaw "for his work which is marked by both idealism and humanity, its stimulating satire often being infused with a singular poetic beauty"
data.text:
George Bernard Shaw

Documentary

George Bernard Shaw pays tribute to Professor Albert Einstein in an after-dinner speech at the Savoy Hotel in London, England, 27 October 1930.*

Credit: ITN Archive/Reuters

* The event is described in a book by Abraham Pais, Einstein Lived Here (page 181), published by Clarendon Press in 1994.

George Bernard Shaw comments his visit in America.

From SF Veckorevy 1936-04-06.
